item.title: The Al Ain Cultural Programme for 2017/2018 is currently in full swing
item.description:
The Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi recently held three events showcasing Emirati culture and heritage as part of the annual Al Ain Cultural Programme. On October 19th, Qasr Al Muwaiji (Al Muwaiji Palace) hosted the Bisht Workshop, which delved into the history of the traditional garment worn by UAE rulers and the unique patterns associated with each ruler. Attendees also participated in a hands-on workshop, learning to create their own bisht...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-al-ain-cultural-programme-for-2017-2018-is-currently-in-full-swing/

item.title: Jane's Walk Singapore offers a blend of classic and innovative walking tours
item.description:
Source: Jane’s Walk Peatix page. Jane’s Walk logo. The annual Jane’s Walk Singapore, a series of free walking tours led by community members, will take place from May 4th to 6th. Inspired by urbanist Jane Jacobs, these walks encourage participants to share local stories, discover the city, and connect with their neighbors. While many tours are already at capacity, new spots may open up, so interested individuals are encouraged to check back...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/jane-s-walk-singapore-offers-a-blend-of-classic-and-innovative-walking-tours/

item.title: Exploring the history of Bukit Panjang, Singapore
item.description:
Jane’s Walk, a global movement of free walking tours inspired by urbanist Jane Jacobs, continues to thrive in Singapore, with tours often fully booked within hours of being announced. This enthusiastic response highlights the movement’s ability to connect people with their communities and explore urban landscapes. This year, on May 5th, a sold-out walk titled “At the Crossroads: Bukit Panjang” offered participants a unique opportunity to delve into the neighborhood’s rich history...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/exploring-the-history-of-bukit-panjang-singapore/

item.title: World Heritage Map now for sale
item.description:
Source: UNESCO website. The UNESCO World Heritage Centre and National Geographic Maps have released the most recent edition of the World Heritage map. This project received generous support from Turkey, and the map can be purchased on the World Heritage Centre website. The map features an image of Turkey’s Historic Areas of Istanbul, the location of the next World Heritage Committee meeting in July 2016. The poster-sized map displays all 1,031 World Heritage sites, along with pictures and detailed captions...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/world-heritage-map-now-for-sale/

item.title: New sites have been added to the World Heritage List for 2017 by the World Heritage Committee
item.description:
Source: UNESCO. Kulangsu: a Historic International Settlement, China. © Cultural Heritage Conservation Center of THAD / Qian Yi | Image Source: Nomination File (Update). The World Heritage Committee designated 21 new locations to UNESCO’s World Heritage List in 2017. Additionally, the boundaries of five existing sites were expanded or adjusted. These additions bring the total number of sites on the World Heritage List to 1,073. The Asia Pacific region saw the addition of these new natural sites:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/new-sites-have-been-added-to-the-world-heritage-list-for-2017-by-the-world-heritage-committee/

item.title: Pesta Raya by Esplanade is back in July
item.description:
The Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay’s 17th annual Pesta Raya – Malay Festival of Arts will take place from July 12th to 15th, 2018. The festival coincides with Hari Raya Aidilfitri, a celebration that lasts until mid-July. This year, the festival focuses on the history of the Nusantara. Fezhah Maznan, a programmer with The Esplanade Company, stated that Pesta Raya has always celebrated the rich Malay heritage through arts and culture from the region...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/pesta-raya-by-esplanade-is-back-in-july/

item.title: The intangible cultural heritage of North Korea includes the tradition of making kimchi and the rituals surrounding Arabic coffee
item.description:
The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) committee dedicated to safeguarding intangible cultural heritage convened in Namibia and added 20 new elements to the prestigious Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. This list showcases diverse forms of expression that embody intangible heritage and promotes broader awareness of their significance. Concluding this year’s nomination review, the committee inscribed 23 out of 35 proposed elements. On December 2nd, the following entries from the Asia Pacific and Middle East regions were formally included on the list:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-intangible-cultural-heritage-of-north-korea-includes-the-tradition-of-making-kimchi-and-the-rituals-surrounding-arabic-coffee/

item.title: Air Asia provides a complimentary Penang travel guide
item.description:
The low-cost carrier Air Asia is offering a complimentary travel guide for the island of Penang. Source: Air Asia e-DM. Penang, Malaysia is renowned for its distinctive cuisine, the UNESCO World Heritage site of George Town, and its Peranakan culture. The guide, designed to assist event planners organizing trips to Penang, encompasses the following: Food Art, Heritage, Crafts & Cafés Lifestyle & Nature Getting Around Calendar of Events The guide can be downloaded here...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/air-asia-provides-a-complimentary-penang-travel-guide/

item.title: Experience a Festive Showcase of Cultural Treasures at Min Jiang at One-North
item.description:
Min Jiang at One-North is the only Chinese eatery located within a 3,000-square-foot, two-story colonial bungalow. From July 1 to August 31, 2017, Min Jiang at One-North (岷江在纬壹), a Singaporean restaurant specializing in modern Sichuan and Cantonese cuisine, will host “A Celebration of Heritage Delights (欢庆怀念佳肴).” This event offers patrons a chance to enjoy classic dishes popular in Singapore during the 1960s, 70s, and 80s. Since 2006, Master Chef Goh Chee Kong (吴志光) has captivated diners with his exquisitely plated dishes...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/experience-a-festive-showcase-of-cultural-treasures-at-min-jiang-at-one-north/
